page.title: 10BOAT-BUILDING IN OVERTON
page.content: Boat-building in Overton is now carried out on a small scale,in glass-fibre, mostly reproductions of traditional work-boats,from the days of sail,(such as "whammel-boats",pilot punts from Overton,and other "beach-boats"),whose design evolved in various parts of Britain,but are now built here.They are mostly used for pleasure-sailing,and are sold all over Britain,or exported; previously almost all work-boats were for local use,although some yachts were built here.Boats are built here today for fishing in the Lune and at Morecambe.Six 19ft.motor whammel boats, two 30ft.trawlers,and about thirty 12ft."punts"(boarding boats for trawlers),have been built in recent years.The established boat-building family was the Woodhouse family,who built for 200 years.The line ended with the death of Thomas in 1985.
